lead_paragraph: The prosthetic legs that the double-amputee sprinter Oscar Pistorius uses provide less air resistance than normal legs, the International Association of Athletic Federations said yesterday.Pistorius, who wears curved carbon-fiber prosthetic legs, hopes to compete at the 2008 Beijing Olympics. The I.A.A.F., the sport’s governing body, has been reviewing footage of Pistorius’s running the 400 meters Friday in Rome to determine if his prosthetic racing legs give him an unfair advantage. Pistorius ran 46.90 seconds to finish second.
